news.title: Shriram Properties resolves Kolkata land issues with West Bengal government
news.para: Shriram Properties has resolved a long-standing commercial dispute with the West Bengal government. The company conveyed 42.37 acres of land at Uttarpara, fulfilling its obligations. It plans to develop five to six million sq ft of new projects in Kolkata over the next five years. These projects have a potential gross development value of ₹3,000 crore.

news.title: Puravankara posts net profit of ₹58.34 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Puravankara  reported a net profit of ₹58.34 crore for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. This marks a substantial improvement from the ₹92.64 crore loss recorded in the same period last year. Total income also saw a sharp rise to ₹1,104.06 crore.

news.title: RERA doing nothing except facilitating defaulting builders: SC
news.para: The Supreme Court has questioned the effectiveness of Real Estate Regulatory Authorities across India. Justices expressed disappointment, stating these bodies primarily aid defaulting builders. The court suggested states reconsider the very existence of these authorities. This observation came as the court allowed Himachal Pradesh to relocate its RERA office.

news.title: Experion Developers to invest ₹1,500 crore to develop residential project in Noida
news.para: Experion Developers is set to invest ₹1,500 crore in a new residential project named SAATORI in Noida's Sector 151. The project will span five acres and feature three towers, with one dedicated to 4BHK residences.  Singapore and Plandscape Bangkok are the architectural and landscape consultants respectively.

news.title: Exotica Housing to invest ₹500 crore to develop Noida project
news.para: Exotica Housing will invest ₹500 crore in its new IT and ITES project, Exotica One32, in Noida's Sector 132. The project spans five acres with two 27-floor towers offering office spaces from 1,000 to 3,000 sq ft. Integrated retail spaces are also part of the development. Phase-I possession is expected by January 2030.

news.title: DevX inks record coworking deal, takes 27-storey Ahmedabad office tower
news.para: Dev Accelerator has secured a massive 27-storey office tower in Ahmedabad. This deal, valued at over Rs 850 crore, is the largest coworking transaction in India. The agreement is structured as a development management deal. The project is currently under construction and will be ready in about 2.5 to three years.

news.title: First in Andhra Pradesh, Visakhapatnam to get slum rehabilitation authority
news.para: Andhra Pradesh's Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation is establishing a Slum Rehabilitation Authority to redevelop Velampeta and Indira Gandhi Nagar. These pilot projects will transform slums into high-rise apartments through public-private partnerships, offering free housing to beneficiaries and incentivizing developers with TDR and FSI benefits.

news.title: Maharashtra cabinet nod to raise ₹6,000 crore loan for Purandar airport land acquisition
news.para: The Maharashtra government has approved a Rs 6,000 crore loan to acquire land for the Purandar airport project. A special purpose vehicle, with CIDCO holding the majority stake, will manage the greenfield airport's execution. This project is expected to significantly boost development and connectivity in Pune and western Maharashtra.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh budget earmarks ₹750 crore for Noida airport
news.para: Of the total allocation, Rs 750 crore has been allocated for the development of the Noida International Airport in Jewar area of Gautam Buddha Nagar district. The first phase of the airport is being developed in public-private partnership mode.

news.title: Pune: Five years on, RCC structure on Baner Hills still stands despite demolition order
news.para: An allegedly unauthorized RCC structure on Baner Hills, designated as a biodiversity park, remains standing over five years after a demolition notice was issued by the Pune Municipal Corporation. Residents and environmental groups are concerned about delayed enforcement and potential safety risks, as the structure housing a statue has not been removed despite a 30-day demolition directive.

news.title: Glada razes unauthorised colony in Ludhiana district’s Sahnewal action
news.para: Greater Ludhiana Area Development Authority (Glada) demolished an unauthorized colony in Sahnewal, acting on orders from the housing minister. This aggressive campaign targets fraudulent developers who lure buyers with unapproved plots. Glada will pursue criminal charges and FIRs, emphasizing a zero-tolerance stance against illegal urban sprawl and warning the public about infrastructure risks in unapproved colonies.

news.title: Nashik civic body serves notices to 450 property tax defaulters
news.para: Nashik Municipal Corporation has issued notices to 450 property tax defaulters owing over Rs 1 lakh, demanding payment within 15 days. The civic body aims to collect Rs 270 crore this fiscal year but has only gathered Rs 215 crore, facing a Rs 55 crore deficit.

news.title: Maharashtra: NA tax finally abolished, to push redevelopment & regularisation of aging housing societies
news.para: Maharashtra has permanently abolished the annual non-agricultural (NA) tax, a move expected to accelerate redevelopment of housing societies. The reform eliminates the need for separate collector permissions for NA land use, replacing it with a one-time premium at the building-plan approval stage. This structural correction aims to boost real estate and industrial activities while enhancing transparency.

news.title: Eviction decree on one joint tenant applicable to all: Rajasthan HC
news.para: The Rajasthan High Court ruled that an eviction decree against one joint tenant is enforceable against all successors, even if not parties to the case. This decision upholds an eviction order for a property occupied by family members after the original tenant's death, rejecting claims of non-impleadment and oral sale.

news.title: Canara Bank invites bids to sell ₹577-crore Supreme Housing loan
news.para: Canara Bank is selling ₹577 crore debt of Supreme Housing and Hospitality. A Swiss challenge auction is planned. The bank has also filed a petition to restart insolvency proceedings. This follows a failed one-time settlement offer by the company. The auction aims to gauge investor interest. Bids are due February 21. An electronic auction is scheduled for March 13.

news.title: Gujarat: Stalled WTC project to be given to allottees’ body for completion
news.para: Gujarat's chief secretary-led committee will hand over the stalled World Trade Center project in GIFT City to its allottees. This unprecedented move aims to complete Towers B and C after the original promoter's arrest. Allottees are forming associations to fund and manage the construction. The state government will facilitate this process, ensuring buyers get possession of their units.

news.title: Golden Glow Estates on radar in Haryana as project licence lapses and dues cross ₹52 crore
news.para: Haryana's DTCP has initiated action against Golden Glow Estates for a group housing project in Sector 68, Gurugram, whose development licence lapsed eight years ago. Over Rs 51.8 crore in external development charges remain pending. The developer faces proceedings for violating licence conditions and failing to submit mandatory documents.

news.title: Delhi government clears metro's phase V after centre's nod
news.para: Delhi Metro's Phase V(A) is approved, boosting public transport. The project includes a key corridor linking the Central Vista. Three new corridors will connect RK Ashram Marg to Indraprastha, Tughlakabad to Kalindi Kunj, and Aerocity to Indira Gandhi Domestic Terminal-1.

news.title: Bihar government urges Centre to release pending ₹3,000 crore fund under PMAY-Gramin
news.para: Bihar is appealing to the Centre for a financial boost of Rs 3,000 crore to support the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna Gramin initiative. With a deadline looming on March 31, 2026, the state is eager to ensure that over 12 lakh pucca houses are constructed for beneficiaries who are currently waiting for their first installment.

news.title: Skyrocketing rents threaten Greece's economic rebound
news.para: Despite Greece's invigorating economic turnaround, a troubling housing crisis casts a shadow over the recovery. With rents spiraling out of control, individuals  find themselves displaced from their residences. Fueled by a significant housing deficit and foreign investors looking to capitalize, the impact on middle-class households is alarming.
